note.p: Education: Dumfries; Trinity College, Glenalmond; Edinburgh University; Paris. MD (1862, Edinburgh); LLD (St Andrew's); DSc (1909, Leeds)
Career: Lord Chancellor's Visitor of Lunatics (1875-1922); Vice President and Treasurer, Royal Institution; one of the last people to wear Dundreary whiskers
Obituaries: Obituary Notices of Fellows of the Royal Society 1936-1938 vol 2 pp 519-521, plate, by G M Holmes
References: David Millett, 'Illustrating a Revolution: An Unrecognized Contribution to the "Golden Era" of Cerebral Localization' in NR 1998 vol 52 pp 283-305
